active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the trade-offs of 'shifting security left' in SSDLC (integrating security early) versus traditional SDLC bolt-on security. Use real-world examples from tech firms like Microsoft SDL and reference NIST SSDF groups to support arguments, then vote on the most compelling point.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Secure Development Lifecycle (SDLC) Policy. Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security And Risk Management > Security Policy Development > Policy Content and Types > Application and Development Security Policies > Secure Development Lifecycle (SDLC) Policy. Use this FULL CONTENT (complete/synthesized from NIST/web/voters): [Insert full scaffolding layers here as text, including all descriptions, definitions, SSDF details (PO: Prepare Organization - define policy/training/tools; PS: Protect - supply chain/IP protection; PW: Produce - design/coding/review/test securely; RV: Respond - monitor/analyze/prioritize/remediate vulns), RMF (7 steps), SDLC phases mappings, DevSecOps, concept map, prerequisites, big picture, misconceptions, sources as above]. Learning Objectives: [paste array]. Active Learning: [summarize for context]. Scaffolding: [reference 4 layers]. Generate 40 high-quality flashcards following EXACT schema: [paste full structure]. Distractors: [paste protocol]. Ensure: Coverage (10/layer, Bloom's balanced), active recall (no cues in Q), explanations tie to objectives/layers/real-world (e.g., Microsoft SDL), measurable phrasing. Output ONLY valid JSON array of flashcards, no extra text.
